attributes.action: Provide a symbolic apology for the enforced slavery of Black people
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
When remembering the act of parliament that sought to abolish the transatlantic transportation of Black slaves, it is important to raise the need for a symbolic apology from the British government for the enforced slavery of Black people.

The experiences of many Caribbeans and Africans today are testimony to the fact that the legacy of slavery still lives on affecting self-confidence, attainment and assimilation into society.

There has never been an apology from the British government for Black enslavement - ever. Black life was not valued when the act came into force as is evident by the compensation paid to the slave traders but all life is valuable. It is time that this wrong was addressed and a symbolic apology provided.
